intro: Navarretia breweri, commonly known as the Sierra Valley navarretia, is a flowering plant native to California. It is a member of the bellflower family (Campanulaceae) and is characterized by its delicate, white to pale blue flowers. This species typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Navarretia breweri is known for its short stature and is often found in areas with well-drained soil. It plays an important role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators.
